properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 16 at 2:06AM EST by NWS Peachtree City GA
properties.description:
At 206 AM EST...a strong thunderstorm was over Woodstock, or 9 miles
north of Marietta...moving east at 50 mph.

HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind...frequent cloud to ground lightning
and heavy rain.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light...unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.

Some locations in the path of this storm include
Atlanta, Marietta, Lawrenceville, Canton, Cartersville, Dallas,
Cumming, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Smyrna,
Dunwoody, Milton, Kennesaw, Duluth, Woodstock, Acworth, Sugar Hill
and Snellville.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder...you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

LAT...LON 3387 8489 3430 8471 3430 8389 3380 8398
TIME...MOT...LOC 0706Z 272DEG 45KT 3409 8453

WIND...40MPH

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWESTERN HALL...NORTH FULTON...COBB...CHEROKEE...SOUTHEASTERN BARTOW...NORTHWESTERN DEKALB...FORSYTH...GWINNETT AND NORTHEASTERN PAULDING COUNTIES UNTIL 245 AM EST
